actions.text: RISING TO A QUESTION OF PRIVILEGE - Mr. Gephardt rose to a question of privilege, sent to the desk a resolution, H. Res. 236, and asked for its immediate consideration.
DEBATE - The resolution states a question of privilege and pursuant to that status, the House proceeded with one hour of debate on the resolution.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 390 - 8 (Roll no. 294).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Instructing the Committee on Standards of Official Conduct to review the operation of the Bank of the Sergeant at Arms of the House of Representatives.

summary.text: Directs the Office of the Sergeant-at-Arms to cease all bank and check-cashing operations. Directs the General Accounting Office to provide to the House Committee on Standards of Official Conduct copies of the two most recent audits of the Sergeant-at-Arms Bank and the supporting work papers. Instructs the Committee on Standards of Official Conduct or a designated subcommittee to: (1) review such audits and the operation of the Bank for the period covered by such audits through the present; and (2) determine whether the operation of the Bank presents questions of potential violation of the Rules of the House or any other applicable standard of conduct.

titles.title: Instructing the Committee on Standards of Official Conduct to review the operation of the Bank of the Sergeant at Arms of the House of Representatives.
